headline: Dr. Oz’s disastrous Senate campaign reportedly on “life support” as he eyes TV comeback
author: David Reddish
sentences:
There is no way he is going to return to talk about blood pressure and bowel moments [sic] when he could be talking about keeping America great again.”
The move to punditry and away from his medicine-themed talk show should also come as no surprise.

Which is why there has already been talk about him becoming a primetime opinion host.”
Related: Dr. Oz is running a more abysmal campaign than Caitlyn Jenner did, if that’s even possible
“We have not heard the last of Dr. Oz,” another source vowed.

Related: Dr. Oz’s latest attempt at relevance backfires spectacularly
Straw polls for the Pennsylvania Senate seat have found Oz falling far behind his fellow GOP primary contenders despite spending over $5 million on TV ads.

In addition, Oz invited wide criticism by voicing support for the anti-transgender views of JK Rowling, criticizing “cancel culture”, and calling for Dr. Anthony Fauci to be fired over his handling of the pandemic.

Someone yelled "YOU'RE GOING TO LOSE" to Dr Oz as they were walking into the Keystone office building.

He knows his campaign is on life support.”
“Like any good doctor, he is already looking for alternatives to keep his career alive if he doesn’t win.
First, he saw his syndicated talk show pulled from reruns on a number of stations in three major markets to avoid violation of the equal time rule.

— Brendan McNulty (@VoiceofBrendan) March 14, 2022
Hannity endorsing Dr Oz is like The Joker endorsing The Penguin but far worse.
Throughout its 13-season run, Oz and his show endured wide criticism over his endorsement of untested medical treatments.
“He is only 61-years-old and isn’t ready to retire if he doesn’t go to Washington DC,” sources told the site.

— Sean Kitchen (@pennslinger) March 15, 2022
I challenged Dr Oz to a debate… I dunno… like a few weeks ago.
Radar Online reports that Oz has begun to plot his return to television in anticipation of his Senate loss.
Since announcing his candidacy last November, he has tripped over one obstacle after the next.
Fortunately for him, his appearances on Fox News and Newsmax have impressed the bosses.
In the meantime, Twitter continues to have a field day bashing Oz’s flailing campaign.
“Who knows, maybe he will be more powerful on primetime than sitting in the Senate.
Oz, 61, currently seeks to represent the people of Pennsylvania in the US Senate.
Ratings for his show also plummeted in markets where it remained on the air.
There is no doubt that he is a very gifted communicator on TV.
“No one wants to admit defeat, but he isn’t a stupid man.
Definitely a state employee and hopefully a union member.
Reality has apparently caught up with Dr. Mehmet Oz.
